title: C88-1044

sentences.text: This paper presents necessary and sufficient conditions for the use of demonstrative expressions in English and discusses implications for current discourse processing algorithms .
We examine a broad range of texts to show how the distribution of demonstrative forms and functions is genre dependent .
This research is part of a larger study of anaphoric expressions , the results of which will be incorporated into a natural language generation system .

Entity-this_paper.label: This paper
Entity-this_paper.description: A research paper that presents necessary and sufficient conditions for using demonstrative expressions in English, discussing their implications on discourse processing algorithms.

Entity-the_distribution_of_demonstrative.description: The phenomenon where the usage patterns, types, or frequencies of demonstrative expressions (such as 'this', 'that', etc.) vary depending on the genre of text.

Entity-necessary_and_sufficient_conditio.description: The set of rules or criteria that must be met in order for demonstrative expressions (such as 'this' and 'that') to be used correctly in English language.

Entity-current_discourse_processing_algo.label: current discourse processing algorithms
Entity-current_discourse_processing_algo.description: Computer programs or models used to analyze, understand, and generate human language in real-time, taking into account the context and structure of ongoing conversations.

Entity-demonstrative_expression.description: A type of linguistic expression used to refer back to a previously mentioned entity or concept.

Entity-genre_dependent.description: A characteristic or property that varies depending on the specific type, category, or classification (e.g., literary work, academic paper) to which it belongs.

Entity-discourse_processing_algorithm.label: discourse processing algorithms
Entity-discourse_processing_algorithm.description: Computer programs or models that analyze, interpret, and generate human language to facilitate communication

Entity-anaphoric_expression.label: anaphoric expressions
Entity-anaphoric_expression.description: A type of linguistic expression that refers back to an earlier mention or concept in the discourse, often using pronouns or other devices.

Entity-natural_language_generation_syste.label: natural language generation system
Entity-natural_language_generation_syste.description: A software or computational model designed to generate human-like natural language text.

summary: This paper presents necessary and sufficient conditions for the use of demonstrative expressions in English and discusses implications for current discourse processing algorithms . We examine a broad range of texts to show how the distribution of demonstrative forms and functions is genre dependent . This research is part of a larger study of anaphoric expressions , the results of which will be incorporated into a natural language generation system .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject provides or offers something to someone else. This can be a statement, an argument, evidence, conditions, rules, or any other type of information that is being shared with others.

Predicate-examine.label: examine
Predicate-examine.description: To examine means to carefully consider or investigate something, typically with the intention of gaining insight, understanding, or making an informed decision. The subject performs this action on the object, which can be a person, thing, idea, or concept.

Predicate-is_part_of.label: is part of
Predicate-is_part_of.description: The predicate 'is part of' indicates that the subject has a relationship with the object where it constitutes or forms a subset, component, or element within. This connection suggests an inclusionary or compositional relationship between the two entities.

Predicate-will_be_incorporated_into.label: will be incorporated into
Predicate-will_be_incorporated_into.description: The predicate 'will be incorporated into' indicates that the subject's content or essence will be merged with or become a part of the object. This implies a process of integration, assimilation, or absorption where the subject's characteristics are absorbed by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or member of a more general category or class denoted by the object. In other words, it establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject is a narrower or more specialized version of the object.
